question: Can I refinance my mortgage to lower my interest rate?
true_answer: Yes, you can refinance to lower your interest rate. Your current rate is 4.5%, and new offers are around 3.5%.

steps.content: Can I refinance my mortgage to lower my interest rate?
Plan: 1) Check current mortgage rate. 2) Hand off to home_loan_agent for market rates. 3) Involve credit_agent for credit score impact. 4) Supervisor review. 5) Deliver final answer.
The current average mortgage rate for a 30-year fixed loan is around 3.5%.
Checking user's credit score impact on refinancing options.
User's credit score is 720, which is excellent and qualifies for competitive rates.
Will there be any closing costs involved?
Retrieving information on closing costs for refinancing.
Closing costs typically range from 2% to 5% of the loan amount.
Calculating potential monthly savings and break-even point.
Refinancing from current rate of 4.5% to 3.5% could save approximately $200 per month.
Review complete, refinance is beneficial under current conditions.
Yes, you can refinance to lower your interest rate. Your current rate is 4.5%, and new offers are around 3.5%. Closing costs 2-5%, saving $200/month.
User thanked the agents for the assistance.
